thread.title: Former Chelsea team-mates Frank Lampard and John Terry cast aside loyalty in romantic death stare showdown
thread.title_full: Former Chelsea team-mates Frank Lampard and John Terry cast aside loyalty in romantic death stare showdown

author: Lara Martin
title: Former Chelsea team-mates Frank Lampard and John Terry cast aside loyalty in romantic death stare showdown
text:
Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
They made an impressive team at both club and country and there’s no doubt footballers Frank Lampard and John Terry possess that winning mentality and hunger for success. 
So perhaps it’s no surprise the bonds of friendship they built up playing for Chelsea and England went out the window when they were challenged to a death stare competition on Monday night’s Play To The Whistle. 
Forgetting all those World Cup, Euro and Premier League campaigns they fought side by side, the two men donned their fiercest, coldest glares and prepared for the ultimate battle on the ITV2 panel show. Lampard started out strongly (Photo: ITV) The tension was palpable during the clash of the titans (Photo: ITV) Terry was not messing around with his death stare (Photo: ITV) Read More Tough quiz alert! Can you name the 20 Spanish players who have made the most Premier League appearances? 
Viewers could practically feel the tension oozing through the TV screen as the footballers locked eyes with steely glares and got ready to out stare each other for the win. 
Until the sultry tones of Michael Bolton singing How Am I Supposed To Live Without You? blasted through the studio giving the death stare contest a sudden romantic feeling. 
While Terry managed to keep his face poker straight and eyes narrowed as the romantic ballad overpowered the moment, poor Lampard began to waver and soon enough had to turn away giggling. 
Unfortunately that meant Terry won as the first person to break eye contact, laugh or smirk was the loser. 
Terry 1, Lampard 0. 
“No, no, no, no, no!” laughed Lampard. Lampard was first to drop form (Photo: ITV) Holly Willoughby was loving the contest (Photo: ITV) Lampard and Terry appeared on Monday's episode of Play to the Whistle (Photo: ITV) Read More Christine Lampard talks BABIES as she discusses what the future may hold now Frank has retired from football 
Luckily for him, there was a second half, which meant a good chance to regain form and even out the scoreline. 
This time the men were treated to the dulcet tones of Meatloaf singing I’d Do Anything For Love (But I Won’t Do That), followed by LeAnn Rimes’ How Do I Live Without You? 
Both guys managed to keep a straight face, though, until Mousse T’s 1998 classic I’m Horny started up and there was some serious giggling. 
While Lampard was convinced Terry had laughed first, host Holly Willoughby insisted it had been him until reply proved Lampard was right. 
1-1. A reply showed Terry laughed first! (Photo: ITV) They're usually the closest of teammates (Photo: Getty Images Sport Classic) 
So the deciding round began as Holly giggled: “I’ve never seen anything more beautiful in my life!” 
Providing the soundtrack this time was Chris Isaak with Wicked Game, but it was Another Level’s Freaky that had Lampard’s mouth twitching. Point to Terry! 
Final score: Lampard 1 - 2 Terry. 
Good show, boys.
